Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alexxucui>@alexxucui</denchmark-link> , sorry my response took so long. It took until today to find a few minutes to look into this one. I found that the existing mean shfit implementation disallows clusters that hold only a single point, but I don't know any reason for this. (Perhaps it could be a parameter or something.) In any case, I opened PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1536>#1536</denchmark-link> which should fix the issue. I can't think of any easy workaround with the existing codebase, so you'll either have to copy the patch into your code manually, wait until the PR is merged, or wait until the next release that incorporates the patch. (I have been meaning to release 3.0.4 for quite a while now, so I will have to actually find the time to do that in the next few weeks.) Hope this helps! Let me know if I overlooked anything.
